result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew David Garletts

defendant.name: Garletts, Matthew David
defendant.address: 6039 West Mitchell Street, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJG
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Matthew David Garletts in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 15 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/19/22 @ 2p
